;本文展示了高分辨率准连续受激拉曼光谱在低波数旋转跃迁研究中的应用，下降至~11.5 cm;−1;。借助此功能，我们能够测量受 H;2; 扰动的 CO 纯旋转拉曼光谱在 77、180 和 298 K 下从线 S(0) 到 S(20) 的碰撞展宽，并得到相应的展宽系数。还讨论了光谱轮廓中是否存在显着的 AC Stark 展宽。

;
;

;摘要

;

;我们展示了高分辨率准连续（q-cw）受激拉曼光谱（SRS）在低频、纯稀释样品中分子的旋转跃迁以获得碰撞信息。在少数开创性的 q-cw SRS 旋转工作中遇到的主要问题，即由于跃迁的上下态之间的群体差异较小以及交流 (AC) 斯塔克效应的存在而导致的信号弱，已经得到解决：执行光束混合、分离和滤波的光学元件的改进使我们能够使用共线光束几何结构和三通道配置来增强拉曼信号。由 AC Stark 效应引起的线轮廓畸变已被测量并包含在光谱的数值处理中。借助这些扩展功能，我们已经能够记录波数低至 ;∼; 11.5 cm; ;−;1; 的受激拉曼跃迁，对应于 S (0) CO 分子的纯旋转跃迁。我们将该装置应用于 H;2; 扰动的 CO 旋转谱线的碰撞展宽研究，并获得了 S(0) 谱线的展宽系数77、180 和 298 K 下的 S(20)。这些各向异性系数与红外振动实验获得的系数之间的比较显示出极好的一致性。据我们所知，这是使用旋转 SRS 获取稀释气体样品中碰撞信息的首次演示。

;丹尼斯·帕雷德斯·罗伊巴斯、劳尔·Z·马丁内斯研究文章低频旋转跃迁的高分辨率受激拉曼光谱：受 H2 扰动的 CO 旋转 S 分支中碰撞展宽系数的获得10.1002/jrs.6582拉曼光谱杂志10.1002/jrs.6582 https://onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/10.1002/jrs.6582?af=R 研究文章54 10 https://onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/10.1002/jrs.6563?af=R Mon, 16 Oct 2023 01:12:29 -0700 2023-10-16T01:12:29-07:00 Wiley：拉曼光谱杂志：目录2023 年 10 月 1 日，星期日 00:00:00 -0700 2023 年 10 月 1 日，星期日 00:00:00 -0700 10.1002/jrs.6563基于空间外差显微差分拉曼光谱的微塑料样品检测《拉曼光谱杂志》，第 54 卷，第 10 期，第 1090-1098 页，2023 年 10 月。为了实现微塑料的快速、准确检测，本文设计并搭建了空间外差显微差分拉曼光谱（SHMDRS）系统。通过空间外差光谱（SHS）与显微微分拉曼光谱（MDRS）相结合，获得了PS、PC、PP和HDPE四种微塑料样品的拉曼光谱。通过差分拉曼光谱去除荧光干扰，通过多重约束迭代算法成功恢复了四种微塑料样品的纯拉曼光谱。实验表明，所设计的SHMDRS系统具有高光通量、高分辨率、高信噪比的特点，在弱拉曼信号检测中具有一定的优势。摘要 微塑料作为一种新的全球污染物，近年来受到广泛关注。传统的微塑料检测技术存在信号弱、成本高、操作复杂等缺点。因此，本文设计并构建了一套用于微塑料检测的空间外差显微差分拉曼光谱（SHMDRS）系统。该系统将空间外差系统（SHS）与显微差分拉曼系统（MDRS）相结合。利用ZEMAX软件对系统进行仿真设计，并在实验平台上搭建了SHMDRS系统。 531.742 nm 和 532.567 nm 双波长激光器用作激发光源。对PS、PC、PP、HDPE四种微塑料样品进行了测试，验证了该系统的可行性。在积分时间10 s、激光功率200 mW的条件下，分别采用SHMDRS系统和色散光谱仪对微塑料样品进行检测。比较并计算了不同系统拉曼光谱的信噪比（SNR）。利用双波长激光获得了四种微塑料样品的差分拉曼光谱，并通过多重约束迭代算法恢复了四种微塑料样品的纯拉曼光谱。结果表明，SHMDRS系统的光谱分辨率为2.809 cm−1，光谱范围为255.47~2023.21 cm−1。 SHMDRS系统获得的拉曼光谱信噪比优于色散光谱仪，差分拉曼光谱可以有效去除荧光背景的干扰。该方法具有良好的发展前景。 ;

;为了实现微塑料的快速、准确检测，本文设计并搭建了空间外差显微微分拉曼光谱（SHMDRS）系统。通过空间外差光谱（SHS）与显微微分拉曼光谱（MDRS）相结合，获得了PS、PC、PP和HDPE四种微塑料样品的拉曼光谱。通过差分拉曼光谱去除荧光干扰，通过多重约束迭代算法成功恢复了四种微塑料样品的纯拉曼光谱。实验表明，所设计的SHMDRS系统具有高光通量、高分辨率、高信噪比的特点，在弱拉曼信号检测中具有一定的优势。

;
;

;摘要

;

;微塑料作为一种新的全球污染物，近年来受到广泛关注。传统的微塑料检测技术存在信号弱、成本高、操作复杂等缺点。因此，本文设计并构建了一套用于微塑料检测的空间外差显微差分拉曼光谱（SHMDRS）系统。该系统将空间外差系统（SHS）与显微差分拉曼系统（MDRS）相结合。利用ZEMAX软件对系统进行仿真设计，并在实验平台上搭建了SHMDRS系统。使用 531.742 和 532.567 nm 双波长激光器作为激发光源。对PS、PC、PP、HDPE四种微塑料样品进行了测试，验证了该系统的可行性。在积分时间10 s、激光功率200 mW的条件下，分别采用SHMDRS系统和色散光谱仪对微塑料样品进行检测。比较并计算了不同系统拉曼光谱的信噪比（SNR）。利用双波长激光获得了4种微塑料样品的差分拉曼光谱，并通过多重约束迭代算法恢复了4种微塑料样品的纯拉曼光谱。结果表明，SHMDRS系统的光谱分辨率为2.809 cm;-1;，光谱范围为255.47~2023.21 cm;-1;。 SHMDRS系统获得的拉曼光谱信噪比优于色散光谱仪，差分拉曼光谱可以有效去除荧光背景的干扰。该方法具有良好的发展前景。

;我们提出了一种简单的方法来模拟不同压力和氮气、二氧化碳和乙烷浓度下天然气中甲烷的拉曼光谱。提供了算法的详细描述和模拟所需的经验参数。该方法可提高天然气等含甲烷介质拉曼气体分析的准确性。

;
;

;摘要

;

;拉曼光谱是一种很有前景的天然气分析方法。需要测量碳氢化合物浓度来控制该燃料的质量。尽管在 2800–3040 cm;-1; 范围内存在碳氢化合物的强烈特征峰，但由于与甲烷光谱重叠，研究人员避开了该区域。本文提出了一种简单的方法来模拟不同压力和浓度的氮气、二氧化碳和乙烷下天然气中甲烷的拉曼光谱。提供了算法的详细描述和模拟所需的经验参数。该方法可提高天然气等含甲烷介质的拉曼气体分析精度。

;Raman spectroscopy has been studied as a tool for the differential diagnosis of cancer through blood cells, as it has been shown great ability to identify spectral information regarding the cell's biochemical constitution and biomarker compounds present in the blood. Principal component analysis of the Raman spectra suggested occurrences of higher concentration of cytochrome c in normal samples, being an important biochemical marker that discriminates between healthy and neoplastic states, and higher concentration of phenylalanine in the leukemic samples.

;
;

;Abstract

;

;This study aimed to use the Raman spectroscopy technique to identify biochemical changes in blood cell samples of healthy, leukemic, and non-leukemic subjects by principal component analysis (PCA) and to discriminate the groups by partial least squares discriminant analysis (PLS-DA). For the study, 121 blood samples were collected from healthy children and adolescents among those with leukemia and other types of cancer (non-leukemics). A volume of 80 μl of blood cells was placed in an aluminum sample holder and submitted to dispersive Raman spectroscopy (laser: 830 nm and 250 mW), with an exposure time of 30 s. A total of 308 Raman spectra were analyzed and indicated significant differences in the bands referred to nucleic acids (671 and 756 cm;−1;), amino acids (671, 1,215, and 1,544 cm;−1;), proteins (756, 1,215, 1,430, 1,531, and 1,548 cm;−1;), β-carotene (1,531 cm;−1;), and cytochrome c (756 and 1,371 cm;−1;), showing higher intensity in normal samples. The analysis of the PCA variables (PCs) showed that there was a higher concentration of cytochrome c (633, 749, 855, 1,004, 1,127, 1,212, 1,370, 1,433, 1,531, and 1,614 cm;−1;), in the normal samples, and a higher concentration of phenylalanine (1,004 cm;−1;) was observed in the leukemic samples with statistically significant (ANOVA, ;p; < 0.05). Discriminant analysis by PLS-DA model classified the spectra into the groups normal (healthy), leukemic, and non-leukemic with accuracy of 67.5%; when considering normal versus cancer, the accuracy increased to 98.3%, with sensitivity of 100% and specificity of 87.8%. Results demonstrated the applicability of Raman spectroscopy for analyzing biochemical compounds in blood cells, thus identifying the spectral differences between the groups normal, leukemic, and non-leukemic (with other types of cancer). However, it presented a low accuracy due to classification errors when discriminating between the groups leukemic and non-leukemic.

Abstract Structural changes of the human telomeric d(TTAGGG)4 sequence (Tel24) in the presence of sodium ions and urea were studied using SERS spectroscopy. The SERS spectra indicated that Tel24 (4 × 10−5 mol/l) formed an anti‐parallel G‐quadruplex in a medium containing Na+ ions (100 mmol/l), which was disrupted by the subsequent addition of urea (7.2 mol/l). ;Abstract

;

;Structural changes of the human telomeric d(TTAGGG);4; sequence (Tel24) in the presence of sodium ions and urea were studied using SERS spectroscopy. The SERS spectra indicated that Tel24 (4 × 10;−5; mol/l) formed an anti-parallel G-quadruplex in a medium containing Na;+; ions (100 mmol/l), which was disrupted by the subsequent addition of urea (7.2 mol/l). Intensity ratios of SERS bands originating from breathing vibrations of adenine (~730 cm;−1;) and guanine (~660 cm;−1;) rings clearly pointed to the urea-induced unfolding of G-quadruplex. In addition, SERS bands assigned to guanine implied the breaking of Hoogsteen hydrogen bonds, most likely due to the bonding of guanine bases with the urea molecules. Considering various experimental conditions applied, the structure-related SERS response was more pronounced in the silver than in the gold colloid as well as upon NIR (785 nm) rather than Vis (532 nm) laser excitation. The CD spectra of the same colloidal samples supported structural changes of Tel24 obtained by SERS.

Raman spectroscopy was employed in this study to explore the phase transitions and amorphization of FAPbBr3 single crystals under extreme temperature or pressure. Changes observed include two crystallographic transitions at −127°C and −33°C, one crystallographically unresolved transition at −90°C, two pressure‐induced transitions at 0.3 GPa and 2.2 GPa, and an amorphization phase above 3.6 GPa. The low‐wavenumber Raman modes were measured and analyzed as a function of pressure for the first time. Abstract The rapidly emerging perovskites hold immense potential for revolutionizing optoelectronic and photovoltaic applications. However, understanding the complex structural dynamics and their response at extreme conditions in robust environments is crucial for optimizing the practical performance of perovskite‐based devices. Previous X‐ray diffraction studies have shown great potential for studying the average structures of these materials, but for more complex analysis at the local atomic level, Raman spectroscopy is a powerful tool. In this study, temperature‐ and pressure‐dependent Raman spectroscopy was used to elucidate the intricate lattice dynamics, phase transitions, and amorphization of FAPbBr3 single crystals at extreme conditions such as low temperature or high pressure. Temperature‐dependent Raman spectra unveiled significant variations in wavenumbers, full width at half maximum, and the vanishing of specific modes at higher temperatures. These were ascribed to symmetry changes caused by two crystallographic phase transitions at −127°C from orthorhombic to tetragonal and at −33°C from tetragonal to cubic phase. In addition, some of the Raman modes disappeared upon heating at −90°C, which was associated with a crystallographically unresolved transition. Pressure‐dependent Raman scattering revealed two phase transitions at 0.3 GPa and 2.2 GPa, which corresponded to the contraction of the PbBr6 octahedra and their tilting distortion, respectively. Further compression uncovered amorphization at 3.6 GPa, characterized by the vanishing of crystalline Raman modes together with the emergence of broad new modes due to the disorder within the crystal structure. Upon pressure release, the original Raman modes were recovered, indicating the reversibility of the pressure‐induced phase transitions. The changes in the Raman spectra were the most significant, especially in the low‐wavenumber lattice modes, when the FAPbBr3 underwent orthorhombic phase transition. It indicates that the inorganic sublattice is affected by the structural change into the orthorhombic phase caused either by temperature or pressure variation. ;

A data fusion model to forensic differentiate the electrostatic copying paper. Abstract The aim of this paper was to explore the non‐destructive application of fusion spectra model for characterization and differentiation of electrostatic copying papers that could be favourable to give forensic aid in legal cases. Two hundred fifty electrostatic copy paper samples were collected from various markets. All samples were subjected to surface‐enhanced Raman spectroscopy (SERS) analysis from 3500 to 400 cm−1 Raman shift range and attenuated total reflection‐Fourier transform infrared spectrum (ATR‐FTIR) analysis from 4000 to 400 cm−1 wavenumber range, respectively. The spectral data refracted the constituents present in the electrostatic copy papers were cellulose, inorganic filler calcium carbonate and barium sulfate. Fisher discriminant analysis (FDA), multi‐class support vector machine (MSVM) and decision tree (DT) algorithms were used to build the model. The precision rate, recall rate, F‐score and total accuracy were considered as indicators to evaluate the model's performance. The results showed that fusion models were superior to single model. The feature layer fusion model based on MSVM algorithm gave a differentiating power of 100% by grouping all the sample groups. This study demonstrated that spectral fusion model is a feasible and reliable approach for fast and non‐destructive differentiation of electrostatic copying papers. It has great potential in real application scenarios. ;
